Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can show a problem where people need to communicate over a distance by depicting two students far apart with obstacles.
The student can accurately draw a string telephone connecting the two students with clear endpoints.
The student can demonstrate how the string telephone allows communication by showing sound moving through the string.
The student can effectively illustrate the concept of sending and receiving sound information over a distance.
The student can depict how the string telephone solves the communication problem by showing interaction between the students using the telephone.
The student can highlight the importance of technology in communication over long distances by labeling or contextualizing the diagram.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit labels on diagrams for pieces like cups or string, relying on the drawing itself to convey the idea (minor gap in labeling).
The student might not indicate the direction of sound waves within the string, assuming it's implied by the context (assumes viewer infers directionality).
